* Also contains private functions called by main() to execute commands.

* Initializes required objects and contains the main while loop that repeatedly prompts
* the user for input and executes commands based on the input.
* @param args Default parameter for main method.

* Prints all tasks that have been identified to have the keyword in their descriptions.
* @param keyword Keyword to look for in task descriptions.
* Represents an exception that is specific to the Aegis assistant program.
* Constructor for creating a AegisException object.
* @param message String containing more detailed information about the exception.
* Deadline class represents a deadline type of task. A deadline object contains
* a LocalDate field that stores the complete by date of the task.
* Constructor for creating a Deadline object.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Complete by date of the deadline task.
* Returns the deadline task as a string containing its task type, completion status,
* Returns a string in a format for saving to file.
* String is formatted for easy parsing when deadline task is reconstructed using contents
* @return String formatted for saving to file.
* Returns the complete by date of the deadline task in a format for better readability.
* Format follows MMM dd yyyy e.g. Jan 02 2024.
* @return Complete by date of deadline task in format for better readability.
* Returns the complete by date of the deadline task in a format for saving to file.
* @return Complete by date of deadline task in format for saving to file.
* Event class represents an event type of task. An event object contains
* two LocalDate fields that store the start and end date of the task.
* Constructor for creating an event task.
* @param description Description of the event task.
* @param start Start date of the event task.
* @param end End date of the event task.
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {

* Parser class contains methods to check validity and decipher user input commands.
* Constructor for creating a Parser object.
* Returns a boolean that specifies whether the provided input string contains a valid command.
* Returns the command portion (first word) of the user input string in lower case.
* Returns an int that corresponds to the index of a task.
* Returns a string that contains the arguments of a command in the user input string.
* @return String containing arguments for a command.
* Returns a String array containing the arguments required for creating a deadline task.
* Index 0 contains the description of the deadline task.
* Index 1 contains the complete by date of the deadline task.
* @return String array containing arguments for creating deadline task.
* Returns a String array containing the arguments required for creating an event task.
* Index 0 contains the description of the event task.
* Index 1 contains the start date of the event task.
* Index 2 contains the end date of the event task.
* @return String array containing arguments for creating event task.
* Storage class contains methods for reading and writing from a text file.
* Constructor for creating a Storage object.
* @param directoryPath Directory where file is located.
* @param filePath Path to file to read from/write to.
* Returns a String ArrayList that contains the contents of the file that was read.
* Each element in the ArrayList corresponds to an individual line in the file.
* @return String ArrayList containing contents of file.
* @throws IOException If error occurs trying to read from file.
* Takes in a TaskList and writes each task to a file.
* Each task is written to a line in the file containing the task details.
* @param taskList TaskList containing tasks to be written to file.
* @throws IOException If error occurs trying to write to file.
public void writeTaskListData(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {

* TaskList class represents a container that stores and keeps track of tasks.

* Returns the task stored at the specified index.

* Returns the number of tasks currently stored in the task list.

* Changes the status of a task to not completed.

* Each task is printed on a separate line and contains all details of the task such as

* Prints the total number of tasks in a string format for better readability.

System.out.println("There were no tasks matching your keyword.\n");

* Ui class contains methods that get user input and print outputs.
* Prints the logo of the Aegis assistance program.
* Prints a series of dashes that act as a divider.
* Returns a String that is entered into the command line interface by the user.
* Prints a message indicating an error locating file.
